newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Amcoal, Minorco, Rio, Glencore in Colombia coal jv.
newsitem.headline: Amcoal, Minorco, Rio, Glencore in Colombia coal jv.

text.p: Anglo American Coal Corp Ltd said on Friday that it and sister company Minorco SA had reached agreement in principle with unlisted commodity group Glencore International AG and Rio Tinto Plc to form a coal joint venture in Colombia.

Under the deal, the Cerrejon Centrale and Oreganal coal properties in northern Colombia will be combined and the new entity will be owned one-third by Amcoal/Minorco, one-third by Glencore and one-third by Rio Tinto.

"The combination of the two properties enables them to be developed in an optimal fashion, in particular by freeing up immediately an estimated 70 million tonnes of coal in the boundary pillar between them," Amcoal said in a statement.
"It also enables significant savings to be made by sharing the cost of developing common facilities."
The transaction is expected to take up to three months to be concluded.

The four parties and certain of their associates have also submitted a bid for the Cerrejon South property currently being privatised by the Colombian government, Amocal added. If the bid is successful, this property would be combined with Cerrejon and Oreganal to form an integrated operation.
Amcoal said Cerrejon Centrale and Oreganal are expected to have an annual joint production of 16 million tonnes. The addition of Cerrejon South could increase significantly this figure.
